intro: Camptosema isopetalum, commonly known as the slenderleaf camptosema, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes aromatic herbs and some poisonous plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly hairy surface. Camptosema isopetalum is typically found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
